intro: Clarkia purpurea subsp. purpurea, commonly known as the purple clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous annual that produces showy, pink to purple flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. The flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
